cab.content: P.1185AgentsFrom Viceroy, Army Department, to Secretary of State for'India,mil November 1919.(Repealed to Constantinople and Vladivostock under No. 78437.)(Received 29th';)15989. 28th November. Malleson telegraphs, dated 25th Novemberreport four more trains passed west through Merv, period of 18th to 20th NovemberTwo were armoured trains. Total contents of above estimated at 1,850 men, four heavy-guns, ammunition, rails, fuel, live stock and rations. Most troops were Kirghiz andSarts with some Russians, Armenians and Persians. Fighting value of the wholesmall. All civil traffic on railway stopped..Arrivals from Askabad report volunteers captured Kalateh aided by aeroplanes,and main body now west of Geok Tappeh,- Bolsheviks lost considerable rollingstock including armoured train. Teheran informed.Military Secret.
